description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军中将，第二次国共内战期间为中国共产党从事策反工作，失败后在台湾被处决。
description.en: A lieutenant general of the Republic of China Army who engaged in defection-inducement work for the Communist Party of China during the Second Chinese Civil War and was executed in Taiwan after his mission failed.

description.zh-cn: 中国北方地区的武装匪帮的称谓。
description.en: A term for armed bandit gangs in northern China.

description.zh-cn: 民国时期响马首领，曾为徐继武的上级。
description.en: A bandit leader during the Republican era, once the superior of Xu Jiwu.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国北方军阀派系之一。
description.en: One of the northern warlord cliques in the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国奉系军阀首领之一。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Fengtian clique in the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事人物，长期担任徐继武的上级并提拔他。
description.en: A military figure of the Republic of China who was Xu Jiwu's long-term superior and promoted him.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事及政治人物，曾任江苏省主席，与徐继武为旧识。
description.en: A military and political figure of the Republic of China who served as the chairman of Jiangsu Province and was an old acquaintance of Xu Jiwu.

description.zh-cn: 吸收徐继武加入中国共产党的人物。
description.en: The person who recruited Xu Jiwu into the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事人物，曾为徐继武的部下，其被捕牵连到徐继武。
description.en: A military figure of the Republic of China who was a former subordinate of Xu Jiwu; his arrest implicated Xu Jiwu.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国陆军少将，曾任国民革命军第71师师长，为徐继武的策反目标。
description.en: A major general of the Republic of China Army who served as the commander of the 71st Division of the National Revolutionary Army and was the target of Xu Jiwu's defection-inducement efforts.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治及军事领袖。
description.en: A political and military leader of the Republic of China.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国民政部

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国民政部
en: Ministry of Civil Affairs of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 徐继武年轻时加入响马孙美瑶部。
description.en: Xu Jiwu joined the bandit forces of Sun Meiyao in his youth.

description.zh-cn: 徐继武年轻时加入响马孙美瑶部。
description.en: Xu Jiwu joined the bandit forces of Sun Meiyao in his youth.

description.zh-cn: 受北洋政府招安后，徐继武加入奉系军阀张宗昌、徐源泉部。
description.en: After being recruited by the Beiyang government, Xu Jiwu joined the Fengtian clique forces under Zhang Zongchang and Xu Yuanquan.

description.zh-cn: 徐继武在奉系军阀时期，属张宗昌部。
description.en: During his time with the Fengtian clique, Xu Jiwu served under Zhang Zongchang.

description.zh-cn: 徐继武长期在徐源泉部下任职，并受其提拔。
description.en: Xu Jiwu served under Xu Yuanquan for a long period and was promoted by him.

description.zh-cn: 因作战勇猛，徐继武获得其部队长徐源泉提拔。
description.en: Due to his bravery in combat, Xu Jiwu was promoted by his unit commander, Xu Yuanquan.

description.zh-cn: 1928年，徐继武随徐源泉部脱离奉系，加入国民革命军。
description.en: In 1928, Xu Jiwu, along with Xu Yuanquan's forces, left the Fengtian clique and joined the National Revolutionary Army.

description.zh-cn: 徐继武自1935年起代理国民革命军第48师师长，1936年正式接任，直至1938年被撤职。
description.en: Xu Jiwu served as acting commander of the 48th Division of the National Revolutionary Army starting in 1935, officially took command in 1936, and was dismissed in 1938.

description.zh-cn: 徐继武在南京保卫战期间，率领第48师参战，驻守栖霞山。
description.en: During the Defense of Nanking, Xu Jiwu led the 48th Division to participate in the battle, defending Qixia Mountain.

description.zh-cn: 徐继武在武汉会战期间，率领第48师守备大别山。
description.en: During the Battle of Wuhan, Xu Jiwu led the 48th Division to defend the Dabie Mountains.

description.zh-cn: 武汉会战后，徐继武因抗命与徐源泉一同被国民政府撤职。
description.en: After the Battle of Wuhan, Xu Jiwu, along with Xu Yuanquan, was dismissed from his post by the Nationalist Government for disobeying orders.

description.zh-cn: 1948年，时任江苏省主席的丁治磐邀请徐继武担任江苏省政府顾问。
description.en: In 1948, Ding Zhipan, then chairman of Jiangsu Province, invited Xu Jiwu to serve as an advisor to the Jiangsu Provincial Government.

description.zh-cn: 徐继武受董耀卿吸收，成为中国共产党员。
description.en: Xu Jiwu was recruited by Dong Yaoqing and became a member of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 徐继武受中共派遣，前往舟山进行侦察与策反工作。
description.en: Xu Jiwu was dispatched by the Communist Party of China to Zhoushan to conduct reconnaissance and defection-inducement work.

description.zh-cn: 周景玉曾担任徐继武指挥的第48师旅部中校主任参谋。
description.en: Zhou Jingyu once served as a lieutenant colonel staff officer in the brigade headquarters of the 48th Division, commanded by Xu Jiwu.

description.zh-cn: 徐继武的任务之一是策反时任国民革命军第71师师长的董继陶。
description.en: One of Xu Jiwu's missions was to induce the defection of Dong Jitao, who was then the commander of the 71st Division of the National Revolutionary Army.

description.zh-cn: 徐继武撤退到台湾后，作为老同事的丁治磐曾多次周济他。
description.en: After Xu Jiwu retreated to Taiwan, his old colleague Ding Zhipan provided him with financial assistance on multiple occasions.

description.zh-cn: 周景玉因通匪嫌疑被捕审讯，导致徐继武也遭到逮捕。
description.en: Zhou Jingyu's arrest and interrogation on suspicion of communicating with bandits led to the arrest of Xu Jiwu as well.

description.zh-cn: 因策反失败及身份暴露，徐继武被中华民国政府判处死刑并枪决。
description.en: Due to the failure of his mission and the exposure of his identity, Xu Jiwu was sentenced to death and executed by the government of the Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 周景玉原被拟判死刑，后经蒋介石裁定，改判为无期徒刑。
description.en: Zhou Jingyu was originally sentenced to death, but the sentence was commuted to life imprisonment by Chiang Kai-shek.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国民政部

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国民政部于1999年5月18日追认徐继武为革命烈士。
description.en: The Ministry of Civil Affairs of the People's Republic of China posthumously recognized Xu Jiwu as a revolutionary martyr on May 18, 1999.
